top_10_papers.title: Rethinking the confidential cloud through a unified low-level abstraction for composable isolation
top_10_papers.abstract_summary: Introduces Tyche, a security monitor that delegates enforceable, composable, and attestable isolation to a single trusted security monitor using trust domains as building blocks for constructing enclaves, sandboxes, and confidential virtual machines on commodity x86_64 hardware.

top_10_papers.title: Post-Quantum Cryptography and Quantum-Safe Security: A Comprehensive Survey
top_10_papers.abstract_summary: Addresses the transition of post-quantum cryptography from evaluation to deployment, covering lattice-, code-, hash-, multivariate-, isogeny-, and MPC-in-the-Head families alongside performance metrics, hardware acceleration, protocol integration, and deployment scenarios across IoT, cloud, finance, and blockchain sectors with focus on multi-tenant cloud security.

top_10_papers.title: Design and Optimization of Cloud-Native Homomorphic Encryption Workflows for Privacy-Preserving ML Inference
top_10_papers.abstract_summary: Presents a systematic framework for design and optimization of cloud-native homomorphic encryption workflows integrating containerized encryption modules with Kubernetes orchestration, enabling elastic scaling and parallel encrypted computation across distributed multi-tenant environments with up to 3.2x inference acceleration.

top_10_papers.title: A Privacy-Preserving Cloud Architecture for Distributed Machine Learning at Scale
top_10_papers.abstract_summary: Presents a cloud-native framework combining federated learning, differential privacy, zero-knowledge compliance proofs, and adaptive governance powered by reinforcement learning for secure model training with tenant isolation, workload distribution, encrypted service-to-service communication, and identity/access control.

top_10_papers.title: Proof of Cloud: Data Center Execution Assurance for Confidential VMs
top_10_papers.abstract_summary: Introduces Data Center Execution Assurance (DCEA) mechanism that binds confidential VMs to their underlying physical infrastructure using vTPM measurements to ensure CVM launch evidence and TPM quotes refer to the same physical chassis, enabling verification that systems operate on trusted platforms.

top_10_papers.title: ABase: the Multi-Tenant NoSQL Serverless Database for Diverse and Dynamic Workloads in Large-scale Cloud Environments
top_10_papers.abstract_summary: Introduces a two-layer caching mechanism with cache-aware isolation to ensure accurate resource consumption estimates in multi-tenant NoSQL databases, employing predictive autoscaling policy to dynamically adjust resources in response to tenant traffic changes, achieving peak QPS over 13 billion at ByteDance.

top_10_papers.title: NVIDIA GPU Confidential Computing Demystified
top_10_papers.abstract_summary: Examines NVIDIA's GPU Confidential Computing architecture with Hopper generation, analyzing cryptographic isolation mechanisms including per-CVM unique ephemeral keys and AES memory encryption for multi-tenant GPU environments, identifying security weaknesses through instrumentation.

top_10_papers.title: A Multi-Cloud Framework for Zero-Trust Workload Authentication
top_10_papers.abstract_summary: Presents framework utilizing Workload Identity Federation (WIF) and OpenID Connect (OIDC) for secretless authentication using cryptographically-verified ephemeral tokens, reducing attack surface in Kubernetes multi-tenant environments while supporting attribute-based access control across cloud platforms.

top_10_papers.title: Zero Trust Architecture: A Systematic Literature Review
top_10_papers.abstract_summary: Systematic review examining ten years of Zero Trust Architecture research (2016-2025) using PRISMA framework, presenting taxonomy of ZTA application domains including multi-tenant cloud environments with dynamic access policies, real-time authentication, and precise micro-segmentation.

top_10_papers.title: A Novel Zero-Trust Identity Framework for Agentic AI: Decentralized Authentication and Fine-Grained Access Control
top_10_papers.abstract_summary: Proposes framework using Decentralized Identifiers (DIDs) and Verifiable Credentials (VCs) for AI agents in Multi-Agent Systems, incorporating Agent Naming Service, dynamic access controls, and Zero-Knowledge Proofs for privacy-preserving compliance verification in distributed multi-tenant environments.
